Is_Active.Note1: Indicates if the character is active (tagged in & assist)

Stun_Check.Note1: Keeps track of the type of stun on a character.
Stun_Check.Note2:
0: Not being hit or thrown. Doesn't activate if Super Armor absorbs hit
1: Is Throwing
2: Being thrown
3: Being hit. Doesn't stop if character dies (until they disappear)

Action_Flags.Note1: Tends to show which state the character's attack is on. Ex. Tag

Animation_Timer_Main.Note1: Used for various attack and move durations, such as supers and dashes
Animation_Timer_Main.Note2: Related to mashing, ex: hail storm (mashing will prevent this number from decreasing at its normal rate)

Normal_Held_Direction.Note1: If left or right are held when pressing a normal. Also Dash Direction
Normal_Held_Direction.Note2:
0: Default
1: Left + Attack button
2: Right + Attack button

Color.Note1: Main palette. Palette changes when character is hit usually
Color.Note2:
0: LP
1: LK
2: HP
3: HK
4: A1
5: A2

X_Position_Arena.Note1: Character's x-position in the entire arena

Y_Position_Arena.Note1: Character's y-position in the entire arena (0 to 900)

Z_Velocity.Note1: Could be wrong, as it never gets used? 2D

Trip_Checker.Note1: A type of stun tracker. Used for explicitly tracking tripped during combos
Trip_Checker.Note2:
36: Air Throw Stun
73: Most air stuns
146: Tripped (Falling)

Y_Gravity.Note1: Up-Down gravity value. Maybe tied to Y-Boost

Z_Gravity.Note1: Could be wrong, as it never gets used? 2D

X_Position_Screen.Note1: Character's x-position on the current screen

Y_Position_Screen.Note1: Character's y-position on the current screen

Facing_Right.Note1: Keeps track of the direction the character is facing

Unknown_0x012C.Note1: Seems to be always 1, unsure will note more context.

Anim_AnimationFlag_0x00.Note2: Range 0x0140 to 0x154 is copied from animation data. [0x0140,0x0154)

Anim_AnimationFlag_0x01.Note1: Used in character programming. Example: Rogue's DiveKick uses flag to set NJ Mode

Animation_Value.Note1: Displays which sprite number is being shown on-screen.
Animation_Value.Note2: Can be increased starting from 0 for sprite rips

Proxblock.Note1: Indicates if the particular attack can cause proximity block. Contains other values
Proxblock.Note2:
20: Is causing Proximity-Block & Cannot cancel move?
128: Is causing Proximity-Block
64: Is not causing Proximity-Block

Is_Prox_Block.Note2:
0: Neutral
1: Air
2: Dashing
3: Crouching
4: Turning Around
5: Ground Block
6: Air Block
7: Stand Punches
8: Stand Kicks
9: Crouch Punches
10: Crouch Kicks
11: Air Punches
12: Air Kicks
13: Stunned
14: ???
15: Throwing
16: Being Thrown
17: OTG Rise
18: Match Start
19: Win Pose
20: Tag-in & OC Launcher
21: Specials & Snapbacks
22: Supers
23: ???
24: Assist Related
25: ???
26: Air Dash

Hitstop2.Note1: Keeps track of the hitstop after an attack connects

Attack_Number.Note1: Displays the current attack by its memory ID
Attack_Number.Note2: Unique to each character. Large range. Only for attacks

Attack_Unknown_0x01A2.Note1: Seems to be used for attack data.

Special_Strength.Note1: Tracks the strength of specials. On PCSX2, setting these to 10+ allows some A2 bugs.

CharacterSlot_0.Note1: Is for keeping easy track of character slot.

Normal_Strength.Note1: Tracks where normal attacks are done (ground/nj/sj)

Knockdown_State.Note2:
0: Neutral
1: Walking
2: Normal Jump Rise
3: Normal Jump
4: Landing
5: Crouching
6: Crouched
7: Stand Rise
8: Stand Turn
9: Crouch Turning
10: Forward Dashing
11: Back Dashing
12: Double Dizzy // DC-only
13: Super Jump Rise
14: Super Jumping
15: Air Recovery
16: ???
17: Knockdown Rise
18: Ground Block
19: Air Blocking
20: Normal Attacks
21: Special Attacks
22: Post-Match Pose
23: Extra OTG Stun
24: Neutral Flight
25: Corner Jump
26: Air Dash
27: Tech Hit
28: Switching & Assists
29: Supers & Flashes
30: Throwing
31: Being Thrown
32: Stunned
33: ???
34: Command Launcher

Walking.Note2:
0: Walking or rolling forward
1: Walking backward
255: Standing

Jumping_Special_Counter.Note1: Tracks actions in a Normal Jump

CornerJump.Note1: tracks if character has used corner jump in their current jump

Unfly.Note1: Jump-state and by extension, Unfly tracker. 0-255.
Unfly.Note2:
0: Default
1: Lowest number after attacking (cannot attack during unfly)
17: Normal Jump (NJ Unfly can be done) & Chain-Unfly
18-255: Unfly is active
255: Attacked and landed on feet. "Full Unfly Meter"

Jumps.Note2:
0: Grounded
128: Has not occurred
1: has occurred

Block_Stun.Note1: Displays the expected blockstun after hitstun.

Dizzy_Reset_Timer.Note1: How long until the dizzy-timer resets back to 0
Dizzy_Reset_Timer.Note2: 60 frames after the character stops being hit

Special_Attack_ID.Note1: Displays the special/super attack ID in decimal

Throw_Immune.Note2:
0: Default
2: OTG
4: Is getting up from OTG. Counts down to 0.

Attack_Immune.Note1: Keeps track of when a character is immune to attacks.
Attack_Immune.Note2:
0: Can be hurt
1: Cannot be hurt
2: Is snapped out

Incoming_Timer.Note1: Tracks time before character can do special/super on Incoming

Move_Disable.Note1: if on, character cannot do anything. Used in FSD-Dash

Assist_Onscreen.Note1: Seems to go to 1 when assist is called or has "finished"

Assist_Leaving.Note1: Seems to go to 1 when Assist is jumping off screen

Airborne.Note1: Whether or not the character is in the air.

SJ_Counter.Note1: For Super Jump Install. Tracks ascent, descent and grounded or normal jump
SJ_Counter.Note2:
0: Grounded or Normal Jump
1: SJ-Ascending
2: SJ-Descending

Corner_Touch.Note1: Indicates if the character is touching a corner

PunchKick.Note1: Displays whether attack is punch or kick; doesn't reset after attack finishes.

Normal_Location.Note1: Tracks if left or right are held when pressing an attack
Normal_Location.Note2:
0: Default
1: Left + Attack button
2: Right + Attack button

Hyper_Armor.Note1: Indicates if character has Hyper Armor

Idle_Hover.Note1: Displays whether the character is hovering during idle animation (ex: magneto & storm)

Landing_Shake.Note1: Screen-shake that occurs when the character lands from a jump

PointEnemy_PLMEM_PTR.Note1: Points to Opponent's Point Character PLMEM

Guardbreak_Flag.Note1: Keeps track of how many attacks have been blocked during normal jump state
Guardbreak_Flag.Note2: Only tracked during NJ or Unfly

Block_Meter.Note1: Tracks blocked attacks, used for autoblock and fast-fall
Block_Meter.Note2:
> 0: Can fast-fall
Related to autoblock. 
Pushblock freezes number.

FlyingScreen.Note2:
0: Character has not had FS triggered on them
1: Character has been hit by an attack that caused Flying Screen

Magneto_Throw_Toggle.Note2:
0: Inactive
128: Active/Possible to do the bug

Air_Recovery_Timer.Note1: Tracks when the dummy will be able to attack after being hit in the air

Throw_Limiter.Note1: Tracks if the character can be thrown
Throw_Limiter.Note2:
0: Has not been thrown
1: Has been thrown once
2: Has been thrown twice. Cannot be thrown until it resets to 0

THC_State.Note1: Tracks Assist and THC Values. 4 is NO FS
THC_State.Note2:
0x00: is assist call
0x01: is tag
0x02: is a incoming (not tag)
0x03: alpha counter. 
0x04: is a sort of setup for A1+A2 teamSuper call
0x05: level 3 team super without the team super icons animation
0x06: just super portrait animation
0x07: attacking tag in current character
0x08:attacking tagin as well
0x09: get offscreen after assist and taunt animation

Throw_RNG.Note1: RNG Value that dictates whether a throw will be mashable to its limit

FSI_Combo.Note1: Flying Screen lnstall combo counter related to points

FSI_Points.Note2:
9: FSI-1 (FS will be set in 2 hits)
11: FSI-2 (FS will be set in 1 hit)

FSI_Projectile.Note1: If the projectile possesses FSI ability

X_Position_From_Enemy.Note1: Character's x-distance away from the point-character opponent
X_Position_From_Enemy.Note2: Varies. Tracks to center-point which isn't always reachable

Snapback_Timer.Note1: Tracks how long until the snapped-out character can come back in. 4-Byte

Damage.Note1: Tracks how much damage the character is receiving from the current attack
Damage.Note2: Varies by character defense and damage scaling.

BUTTON SEQUENCE BUFFER MEMORY.Note1: Button Sequnce Areas seem to vary with character.
BUTTON SEQUENCE BUFFER MEMORY.Note2: 0x384 Can be DQCF for one characer but FDP for another. Same with any other area in region.

Powerup_Modifier.Note1: Affects the default strength of attacks

Super_Armor.Note1: Indicates if the character has Super Armor

Healing_Timer.Note1: Rate of healing while tagged out

Y_Position_From_Enemy.Note1: Character's y-distance away from the point-character opponent
Y_Position_From_Enemy.Note2: Varies. Tracks to center-point which isn't always reachable

PlayerID_1.Note1: Pretty sure its playerID, could be "controllerID" but sure its former

CharacterID_2.Note2: Used for out of match logic

PaletteID_2.Note2: Used for out of match logic

CharacterSlot_1.Note1: Is for keeping easy track of character slot.
